column5: I think this should be on all creeks and streams. The Mad and Noicy as well as Willow . JMO
There's poaching and then there's native brook trout poaching...send him to the wolves
right in the old home town...brutal...im sure my buddies are not gonna be impressed with this one.  Not surprised though.. the purp is from Acton ahhaa

right in the old home town...brutal...im sure my buddies are not gonna be impressed with this one.  Not surprised though.. the purp is from Acton ahhaa   Sometime you have good info, but sometimes, you are out in left field. Dont take it personal, I too go out there. LOL
Sometime you have good info, but sometimes, you are out in left field. Dont take it personal, I too go out there. LOL  its a georgetown acton thing...its in my blood
its a georgetown acton thing...its in my blood   LOL
its a georgetown acton thing...its in my blood It worth the drive to Acton, because then you're almost in Georgetown....

4 little brookies...might have had one pound of meat.... $2500 a pound. Makes me feel a little better about what I spent on steaks this past weekend  That's a pretty stiff fine for what his infraction's where.  Glad to see it.

4 little brookies...might have had one pound of meat.... $2500 a pound. Makes me feel a little better about what I spent on steaks this past weekend  That's a pretty stiff fine for what his infraction's where.  Glad to see it. The amount of money, blood, sweat, tears, time etc put in to preserving the fragile fishery of native brook trout in rivers like Credit, only to have a dirtbag like him come in and exploit it...doesn't seem so minor to me.

The amount of money, blood, sweat, tears, time etc put in to preserving the fragile fishery of native brook trout in rivers like Credit, only to have a dirtbag like him come in and exploit it...doesn't seem so minor to me. I agree with you 100%. My comment was more about seeing other examples of how the resources where raped far worse and the fines where much lower.
Just shut it down  , with the heat and low water some one fishing by the rules catching and releasing could easily kill 4 fish as well.

just told my buddy about this...hes done a bunch of volunteer work up there and is not a happy camper...  The fines this guy is paying isnt even coming close to touching the efforts put in by volunteers to assist with stocking this fishery.

I hope they get over to the special regs section of the Grand near Fergus/Elora. Lots of violations occuring at times.  Right about now would be a good time to check. Worm containers sitting on the shore and a forked stick in the bank kind of gives it away.

I may be mistaken, but I think I actually drove past this while it was happening. I was driving in to work on a Saturday or Sunday and saw a couple older guys fishing in what looks like a little less than a ditch and culvert in the Upper Credit with a CO gathering up their equipment. I wanted to stop and ask what was going on but thought better of it. This is hilarious, in a sad way.

I hope they get over to the special regs section of the Grand near Fergus/Elora. Lots of violations occuring at times.  Right about now would be a good time to check. Worm containers sitting on the shore and a forked stick in the bank kind of gives it away. And there's this too. I could walk them right down to the shore and tell them who to look for. I walk my dog along the bank and see this all the time (not enough to make 100% judgment, but it's easy to be very suspicious).  I'd bet most would plead ignorance but it's not an excuse.
